results.title: Ramp Riot 111
results.brief_description: Watch the rad action of the world’s best skaters in “Ramp Riot 111” held at Festival Hall, Melbourne, in November 1989. Chris Miller, Jeff Phillips and Bod Boyle from the USA, battle the top Aussie skaters, Gary Valentine, Adam Luxford, Jason Ellis, Tony Hallam and Lee Ralph. This program highlights the unreal action from this event, including footage never seen before which was actually shot from inside the ramp.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: He’s on a mission and that’s just where he belongs! He’s told not to engage the enemy. “Just take pictures”, they say. But telling Rambo to hold back is like ordering a rattle-snake not to bite. Rambo’s dropped into the Vietnam jungle to find out if there are still any POW’s about. There are. And now Rambo’s going to get them home - on his own! Caption version only available. Rated: M
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II
results.creator_credit: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Rambo is sent on a secret mission to help the U.S. Government find remaining Prisoners of War in Vietnam. However, although the mission is designed to fail, the bureaucrats did not take into account Rambo’s fierce determination, courage and skill to bring them back - alone if necessary. Rambo is launched into the jungle and the film explodes into one fireball action sequence after another.

results.title: Rambo Issues 1985
results.brief_description: A current affairs style program, with panel members - including Phillip Adams and Max Teichman - discussing the political and moral implications of the film “Rambo”. Excerpts from Rambo are discussed alongside recorded interviews with a Vietnam veteran and a representative from a South American refugee organisation.

results.title: Rambo III (Captioned)
results.brief_description: John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself caught in the war torn Middle East, after his longtime friend, Colonel Trautmen falls into Russian hands. The Soviets, equipped with state-of-the-art weapons, horrifying hi-tech helicopters, tanks and an army of highly trained men, are capable of annihilating any opposition they encounter. However, Rambo is no ordinary soldier, he’s a one-man army who will face the Russians head-on in the most awesome confrontation of his life.

results.title: Rambo III
results.creator_credit: Peter MacDonald, Buzz Feitshans and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered by many critics to be the best of the three films in the Rambo: ‘First Blood trilogy.’ The film’s plot takes on a righteous turn as the “universal soldier” Rambo seeks to liberate a group of Afghans from under the regime of a brutal Russian General. The action sequences in this film are both spectacular and terrifying, and the enigmatic, not altogether two dimensional character of Rambo rises above the conflagration with more style than in the previous films.

results.title: Rambling Rose
results.creator_credit: Martha Coolidge, Renny Harlin and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: The traditional Southern values of the upstanding Hillyer family are about to be challenged. They’ve just hired a 19-year-old Rose (Laura Dern) as a housekeeper and nanny, unaware of the hilarious disruptions her arrival will cause. The very sweet and kind Rose has uncontrollable sexual impulses which cause her to ramble from man to man, bed to bed, leaving a trail of catastrophes in her wake.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: Ralph Breaks the Internet
results.creator_credit: Ami Thompson, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Video game bad guy Ralph and fellow misfit Vanellope von Schweetz must risk it all by traveling to the World Wide Web in search of a replacement part to save Vanellope’s video game, Sugar Rush. In way over their heads, Ralph and Vanellope rely on the citizens of the internet — the netizens — to help navigate their way, including an entrepreneur named Yesss, who is the head algorithm and the heart and soul of trend-making site BuzzzTube.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ami Thompson, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.description:
When Wreck-It Ralph was released in 2012, audiences were introduced to the loveable videogame villain and real-life good guy Ralph and the sweet, speed-racing sprite Vanellope von Schweetz. Both ostracised in their game worlds – Ralph because he’s the bad guy in an 8-bit arcade game, Fix-It Felix Jr., and Vanellope because her erratic glitching makes her game, Sugar Rush, unstable – the two form a friendship that propels them through Mr. Litwak’s arcade games on an adventure to accept themselves and win a friendship like no other.

Voiced by comedians John C. Reilly and Sarah Silverman respectively, the two characters guided audiences through a neon nostalgia trip into the arcade era and helped the film score at the box office. Aside from the Academy Award and Golden Globe nominations for Best Animated Film, Disney’s 52nd animated film won the Annie Award for Best Animated Feature and led to one of Walt Disney Animation Studios’ rare theatrical sequels (there are only five), Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018).

In the sequel, Ralph and Vanellope journey into the newly introduced internet on a quest to find a replacement steering wheel for Sugar Rush before the arcade owner, Mr. Litwak, retires the broken game and leaves Vanellope homeless. In their adventures, Ralph becomes a viral video sensation on BuzzTube, while Vanellope finds a hero in Shank (Gal Gadot), the tough-as-nails matriarch of gritty online racing game Slaughter Race.

In the pictured concept art, a digital painting by Ami Thompson, Ralph and Vanellope’s spirit of adventure and friendship is on full display, with Penelope directing Ralph onwards and upwards, but as the two adjust to the internet in Ralph Breaks the Internet, their friendship will be tested, evolve and they’ll once again learn more about themselves than they could’ve ever imagined alone.
description_for_label:

images.alt_text: A picture of two animated characters on a blue background. One is Ralph, a thick burly videogame character wearing a red and orange stripped t-shirt and brown overalls with spiky brown hair, and a younger girl on his shoulder with purple hair

results.title: Raku: the ancient art of Japanese ceramics
results.creator_credit: G Roy Levin and Charles Cahill
results.brief_description: The raku process began in the 12th century in Japan growing out of a Zen Buddhist religious ceremony. Raku firing offers the potter many advantages over other techniques, and provides an intimacy and immediacy more deeply felt than any other ceramic process. Narrated by Ann Dumaresq.
results.title_for_label: Raku: the ancient art of Japanese ceramics
